behind me are the sub oipal muscles and they provide proprioceptive information to our balance Center which is located in the brain stem and when that top bone in the upper neck misaligns it can contract the sub oxital muscles and cause mixed signals to our balance Center and cause lightheadedness dizziness and vertigo also when that top bone misaligns and the sub oipal muscles contract it can cause radiating pain up the head head pressure and migraines what we do in our office is take threedimensional X-rays of the upper neck to see which spinal misalignments are interrupting the signaling to our balance Center and with a precise light correction we put the upper neck back in place to release the sub oxital muscles get the proper proprioceptive information to our balance Center and dissipate the vertigo the dizziness the migraines and the headaches comment help for a doctor near you do

migraines affect Millions worldwide causing intense headaches and disrupting daily life while medications offer relief did you know that your diet can play a pivotal role in managing migraines in this video we&#39;ll explore the basics of migraines dietary recommendations backed by research and practical tips for both youngsters and adults migraines are more than just headaches their neurological events characterized by severe pain often accompanied by nausea sensitivity to light and sound and visual disturbances factors like genetics environmental triggers and lifestyle choices contribute to their onset emerging Research indicates that inflammation plays a significant role in migraines adopting an anti-inflammatory diet can help reduce the frequency and severity of attacks incorporating specific foods can Aid in migraine management oats rich in riboflavin vitamin B2 oats can stabilize blood glucose levels and prevent migraines dark leafy greens kale spinach and collared greens provide folate reducing migraine Risk by lowering homocysteine levels fatty fish salmon mackerel and sardines are high in omega3 fatty acids offering anti-inflammatory benefits berries blueberries and strawberries are packed with antioxidants combating oxidative stress linked to migraines turmeric containing curcumin turmeric has anti-inflammatory properties that may alleviate migraines pumpkin seeds high in magnesium hay can prevent migraines especially in those deficient in this mineral walnuts packed with magnesium Omega-3s and vitamin E walnuts reduce inflammation and manage blood sugar levels aiding migraine prevention certain foods can trigger migraines processed Meats contain preservatives like nitrates that may induce headaches aged cheeses high in tyramine a known migraine trigger excessive caffeine while small amounts can help overc consumption or sudden withdrawal can lead to migraine implementing dietary changes can be straightforward regular meals maintain consistent meal times to prevent blood sugar dips hydration aim for 2 L of water daily moderate caffeine limit to 3 cups of coffee or six cups of tea per day food diary track foods and migraine occurrences to identify personal triggers adopting a migraine friendly diet benefits all ages youngsters improved concentration better school performance and enhanced mood adults increased productivity reduced absenteeism and overall improved quality of life while migraines can be be challenging understanding dietary influences offers a proactive approach to management by embracing a balanced diet and recognizing personal triggers you can pave the way for a life with fewer migraines always consult with healthc Care Professionals before making significant dietary changes if you found this video helpful don&#39;t forget to like share and subscribe for more health related content let us know in the comments have dietary changes help you man manage migraines stay healthy and see you in the next video

if you&#39;re desperate to get rid of your chronic migraines once and for all then this video is for you I suffered with migraines for 53 years I started getting them at least monthly at 13 in my 20s and 30s I&#39;d have a migraine weekly and sometimes more often than that when they started interrupting my life and interfering with the quality of my work my livelihood I was desperate to make them stop anything to make them stop actually I would have paid anything just to make them go away my docs tried a few different meds and I paid a bundle on different therapies but honestly the only thing that consistently worked during an active migraine was aspirin eating aspirin like they were M&amp;M&#39;s and laying down in a cold dark room after about 10 years of that I developed stomach ulcers from all the aspirin that left me with extra strength Tylenol which barely touched the pain basically I learned to live and work with migraines and be thankful for the times that I was migraine free so imagine how deliriously happy I was when about two weeks after starting this system my migraine slowed down and became less and less frequent and after 6 weeks they were gone entirely I haven&#39;t had a migraine since May 31st that&#39;s 15 weeks or 104 days but who&#39;s counting I will be on this system for the rest of my life if for no other reason than to live without migraines

did you know that certain foods might be responsible for your migraines if you&#39;re tired of dealing with the pain today I&#39;ll show you what to avoid to keep those episodes away migraines can be triggered by several factors and diet plays a significant role if you&#39;re looking for ways to manage this pain the secret May lie in avoiding specific Foods aged cheeses cheddar parmesan and gorgona are loaded with tyramine a villain for migraine sufferers chocolate unfort Ely our beloved chocolate can be a trigger due to caffeine and pheno ethylamine caffeine while it can provide some relief excessive caffeine consumption might worsen migraines processed foods sausages and bacon contain nitrates and nitrites which dilate blood vessels and may trigger attacks alcohol red wine and beer red wine contains histamines and sulfites while beer has tyramine both are migraine triggers monosodium glutamate MSG this flavor enhancer found in many processed foods can be a significant trigger citrus fruits and acidic Foods healthy as they are citrus fruits like oranges and lemons can irritate the stomach and worsen headaches a good strategy is to keep a food diary to identify which of these foods are your biggest triggers and avoid them if migraines are still affecting your quality of life it&#39;s essential to seek help from a medical specialist they can help pinpoint the cause and guide you toward the best treatment for your case now that you know what to avoid start making changes to your diet and see the results share in the comments if any of these foods have caused you trouble and don&#39;t forget to subscribe to the channel for more Wellness tips

are you or somebody you know dealing with chronic headaches migraines and even brain fog it feels like you&#39;re taking all the Tylenol all the ibuprofen and that&#39;s only putting a Band-Aid on the problem and not getting to the root cause of the issue a lot of times when there&#39;s a misalignment in the upper neck it can irritate and inflame all the nerves that run through here as well as obstruct the blood flow two of the main reasons for these chronic headaches and migraines is just that the lack of blood flow as well as an irritation and inflammation on the nerves that control all of the sensation to the head and face so what we do as upper cervical chiropractors is take specific Imaging of the head and neck to know exactly how these top two bones have misaligned when they are misaligned it can irritate and inflame the brain stem and those nerves as well as obstruct that blood flow so what we do is make gentle corrections to this region based on the specific scans that we take to correct the structural misalignment in the top of the neck and get rid of these symptoms once and for all

if you have pain at the base of the skull or where your head and neck meets it always feels heavy or full or you have radiating pain up the back of the head and you&#39;ve done everything you&#39;ve taken the painkilling meditation you&#39;ve done massage you&#39;ve done art nothing seems to help those muscles may get temporary looser but then they just lock back down and you&#39;re left with these terrible symptoms and you&#39;re your wits end and you&#39;re looking for a solution often times the root cause of these problems are a structural misalignment between the head and the neck trauma in the form of car accidents sports injuries and blunt trauma can cause the top vertebra right where the head sits to structurally misalign and one of the first things that happens is those sub oxital muscles at the base of the skull Titan if this sounds like you leave a comment in the comment section below we can find you a specialist in your area who focuses on the upper cervical spine and locating where you&#39;re out of alignment how to correct it and get you better

being pregnant is fun but being pregnant and dealing with chronic migraines is not and today was one of those days so let&#39;s hang out together I felt pretty much fine all morning and then all of a sudden it just hit me like a ton of bricks my head started pounding but there were so many things I wanted to get done today because I feel like the next few weeks are just pure chaos there have so much going on and today I had a free day to just basically do nothing but Nest get things organized get things prepared I did put some makeup on because I haven&#39;t taken my 32- week pregnancy updates yet I usually do a Polaroid photo and then a video and since I&#39;m almost 33 weeks pregnant I really wanted to get this done today I always get comments on my migraine videos saying that I don&#39;t really actually suffer from migraines because if I actually had a migraine I&#39;d be in bed have been a ball crying and while that is very true and that happens to me many many times I&#39;ve also been living with migraine since I was in Middle School so I found ways to cope as much as I possibly can one area that I really wanted to clean and organize today was my laundry room because it is an absolute disaster there&#39;s no organization to it there&#39;s empty bottles everywhere so I started the process of doing that the shelf on top of my washer and dryer was so dusty and disgusting I could not believe it so I clean all that off threw away empty bottles expired products and just tried my best to get some progress done on the laundry room despite feeling like absolute crap my goal when going through the house right now to declutter isn&#39;t to necessarily organize and make everything aesthetic but more so to get rid of things that we don&#39;t need and put things where they belong so that I can then go in get some cute organizers make it look aesthetic and pretty but that&#39;s not really what I&#39;m focused on right now I posted some before and after pictures on my Instagram story this morning of my medicine cabinet my spice cabinet because I went through those before I got my migraine so I&#39;m glad I at least got that done I&#39;m making progress little by little every day which I&#39;m happy about Nick has been working on the nursery day and night he&#39;s really trying to get everything done so that I can go in and organize everything because right now everything is in our Loft I actually feel like I&#39;m hoarding things but I promise you all of this stuff is going to have a home it&#39;s going to look so nice and organized and I cannot wait for that day I&#39;m going to have to finish the laundry room another day because my head was just not doing well and I needed to stop for the night I went downstairs to find my ice cap couldn&#39;t find it there and I found out it was in The Loft in the little mini fridge that we have in there that is literally surrounded by baby things so I grabbed that and then I hung out with Nick in the nursery I hate being alone when I&#39;m in pain and he brings me so much comfort so I just hung out with him until he was finished for the night
